00031 void Set(int * array, int n, int value)
00032 {
00033         int i;
00034         if(n > 0)
00035         {
00036                 for(i = 0; i < n; i++)
00037                 {
00038                         array[i] = value;
00039                 }
00040         }
00041         else
00042         {
00043                 if(n == 0)
00044                 {
00045                         for(i = 0; i < value; i++)
00046                         {
00047                                 array[i] = i;
00048                         }
00049                         
00050                 }
00051         }
00052 }
00053 
00054 extern int Between( int low, int high )
00055 {
00056         int temp;
00057         int range;
00058         
00059         if(high == low)
00060                 return high;
00061         else
00062         {
00063                 if(high < low)
00064                 {
00065                         temp = low;
00066                         low = high;
00067                         high = temp;
00068                 }
00069         }
00070         
00071         high++; // to include upper limit
00072         range = high - low;
00073         
00074         return ( ( rand()% range ) + low );
00075 }
00076 
00077 
00078 extern float Between(float min, float max)
00079 {
00080     return (rand()*((max-min)/RAND_MAX)) + min;
00081 }

00084 // Tries to find a short inside an array of shorts
00085 // returns the index number of found value, or -1 
00086 // if value not found
00087 extern short Inside(short value, short * array, short n )
00088 {
00089         short index = -1;
00090         int i = 0;
00091         for( i = 0; i < n; i++ )
00092         {
00093                 if( value == array[i] )
00094                 {
00095                         index = i;
00096                         break;
00097                 }
00098         }
00099         return index;
00100 }

00102 // Mixes the input array
00103 extern void MixInts( int * array, int n)
00104 {
00105         int i, j, pick;
00106         int * bag;
00107         int limit = n-1;
00108         
00109         bag = new int[n];
00110         if(bag)
00111         {
00112                 for(i = 0; i < n; i++)
00113                         bag[i] = array[i];
00114                 
00115                 // fill new array one item at a time...
00116                 for(i = 0 ; i < n; i++)
00117                 {
00118                         // picking a random position in input array...
00119                         pick = Between( 0, limit );
00120                         array[i] = bag[pick];
00121                         
00122                         // shrinking the number of items in input array.
00123                         for(j = pick; j < limit; j++)
00124                                 bag[j] = bag[j+1];
00125                         
00126                         // eliminate selected option
00127                         limit--;
00128                 }
00129         }
00130 }
00131 
00132 // Sorts (bubble) an array of  ints
00133 extern void SortInts( int * array, int n)
00134 {
00135         int i, j;
00136         
00137         for(i = n; i >= 1; i-- )
00138         {
00139                 for( j = 0; j < i-1; j++ )
00140                 {
00141                         if( array[j] > array[j+1] )
00142                         {
00143                                 int temp;
00144                                 temp = array[j];
00145                                 array[j] = array[j+1]; 
00146                                 array[j+1] = temp;
00147                         }
00148                 }
00149         }
00150 }

00152 // Shows the contents of an integer array
00153 extern void ShowInts( int * array, int n )
00154 {
00155         int i;
00156         for( i = 0; i < n; i++ )
00157                 cout << array[i] << " ";
00158         cout << endl;
00159 }
